channel.title: "Please enter IP address" HELP ME
channel.description: Okay, so, when I start up the client to my server, before the client comes up, a dialog box shows up asking for the server's IP address. Once it's entered, you connect to the server. How do I make the client so it automatically connects to my server's IP? If a picture of what it says and what it looks like will be available upon request. Someone please help :/

item.title: "Please enter IP address" HELP ME
item.dc:creator: @1337_D 1337 :D
item.description:
@1337_D wrote:

It worked perfectly! Now, since I already released my client to the public, do I have to make a new download for them to re-download?

item.title: "Please enter IP address" HELP ME
item.dc:creator: @0wn3r_k4t3 0wn3r k4t3
item.description:
@0wn3r_k4t3 wrote:

So What. …1337 ,

Go to Client Folder > File(or w/e its called) > Client.Java > Go To Directly To The Bottom. Look For Code

Class75_Sub2.aBoolean3314 = false;
	    Class68_Sub9.aString2883 = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null,"Please enter IP address:");
	    Class26.aRSString_521 = Class68_Sub28_Sub2.aRSString_4556;
	    Class68_Sub13_Sub20.anInt3780 = 0;
	    client var_client = new client();
	    var_client.method21(765, 503, 109, 27, "runescape", 508,
				32 - -Class13_Sub4.anInt2690);
	    Class108.aFrame1832.setLocation(40, 40);
	} catch (Exception exception) {
	    Class71.method1339(null, exception, 38);
	}
	anInt2378++;
    }
}

And change that to

		Class75_Sub2.aBoolean3314 = false;
	    Class68_Sub9.aString2883 = "YOURIPHERE";
	    Class26.aRSString_521 = Class68_Sub28_Sub2.aRSString_4556;
	    Class68_Sub13_Sub20.anInt3780 = 0;
	    client var_client = new client();
            CustomSprites.loadCustomSprites(var_client);
	    var_client.method21(765, 503, 109, 27, "CLIENT", 508,
				32 - -Class13_Sub4.anInt2690);
	    Class108.aFrame1832.setLocation(40, 40);
	} catch (Exception exception) {
	    Class71.method1339(null, exception, 38);
	}
	anInt2378++;
    }
}

Hopefully it works <3
